result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley R. Elliott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
BOND APPLIED - BALANCE TO BE RETURNED TO SURETY.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No contact with any person under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent.
No internet or social media access without prior approval from agent.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician; no possession of drug paraphernalia and no possession/consumption of intoxicants.
Do not withdraw from any treatment programs unless given express permission by the agent.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Sex Offender Registry Program under 301.45, Wis. Stats.
Comply with Sex Offender Treatment Programming.

efendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.

timeConds.notes: No good time.  Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentence date with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.  Huber shall be revoked for failure to report and a warrant shall be authorized.  Court authorizes transfer to Manitowoc County.
IMPOSED & STAYED -  Stay may be lifted, in whole or in part, upon written request of the agent with approval and order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence - with good time.    Huber granted, for counseling, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Court authorizes transfer to Manitowoc County.
